Is there any chance we could come up with a more descriptive name? In `LuxDeviceUtils.jl`, `Lux` was the descriptive part of the package name, and the name was okay for an *internal* dependency of `Lux.jl`. But without the `Lux`, neither `Device` nor `Utils` really have any meaning. It's not clear that "Device" refers to GPU/CPU devices, and "Utils" only makes sense in relation to another package that utilizes those utils. So, maybe something like `GPUDataDevices`?
[noblock] Before looking at the package, my guess for what a package `DeviceUtils` would do might have been something similar to [SysInfo.jl](https://github.com/carstenbauer/SysInfo.jl)

That's fair. `GPUDataDevices` suggests it only handles GPUs; currently, it does so because we can't run on other accelerators. But the idea is to add support for all accelerators where we can train models.

How about prefixing with "ML" to `MLDeviceUtils`? While the scope has been broadened from Lux, certain conversion semantics makes more sense in the machine learning context.

`MLDeviceUtils` seems okay… even though "Utils" is never great in a package name except in the narrow context of "dependency for a specific user-facing package". So `MLDataDevices` might be another suggestion, but it's totally up to you.
I think I like `MLDataDevices`. @CarloLucibello any final thoughts here?
This PR can be closed in favor of https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/111642
